@nycopportunity/growingup-patterns v1.0.0-14

Patterns library for Growing Up NYC.


Card

Card Hero

The Card Component with a hero prepends an image to highlight the section of cards.

Demonstration

Child care for babies & toddlers

Program Name

NYC Department of Education

Child Care
Early child care and education services for up to 10 hours a day.

Markup

<div class="bg-color-gray-light p-10">
  <div class="c-card c-card--hero gradient-baby">
    <a href="#">
      <div aria-hidden="true" class="c-card__sticker sticker">
        <svg class="icon--large">
          <title>Cash Expenses</title>
          <use xlink:href="#icon-child-care"></use>
        </svg>
      </div>
    </a>
    <h3 class="c-card__title">
      <a href="#" rel="bookmark" title="Child care for babies &amp; toddlers">Child care for babies &amp; toddlers</a>
    </h3>
    <div class="c-card__subtitle">
      <p>
        <strong>Program Name</strong>
      </p>
      <p>NYC Department of Education</p>
    </div>
    <div class="c-card__tags">
      <a class="button--pill button--pill--alt" href="#">Child Care</a>
    </div>
    <div class="c-card__body">Early child care and education services for up to 10 hours a day.</div>
  </div>
</div>

Card Event

The Event Card adds elements of time and location to the Card component.

Demonstration

Today

Virtual Storytime

11:00 AM - 11:30 AM
Arts & Culture Baby Toddler
Join the library for virtual storytime with books, songs, and tips for early learning.

Virtual Event

Markup

<div class="bg-color-gray-light p-10">
  <div class="c-block-list__item">
    <div class="c-card c-card--subtitle-first">
      <a href="">
        <div class="c-card__sticker sticker">
          <span>Today</span>
        </div>
      </a>
      <h3 class="c-card__title">
        <a role="bookmark" title="Virtual Storytime">Virtual Storytime</a>
      </h3>
      <div class="c-card__subtitle">
        <svg class="icon--xxsmall" role="img">
          <title>Time</title>
          <use xlink:href="#icon-clock-o"></use>
          <span class="nowrap">11:00 AM - </span>
          <span class="nowrap">11:30 AM</span>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div class="c-card__tags order-last">
        <a class="button--pill">Arts &amp; Culture</a>
        <a class="button--pill button--pill--alt">Baby</a>
        <a class="button--pill button--pill--alt">Toddler</a>
      </div>
      <div class="c-card__body">Join the library for virtual storytime with books, songs, and tips for early learning.</div>
      <p class="c-card__link">
        <svg aria-hidden="true" class="icon--xxsmall" role="img">
          <title>Time</title>
          <use xlink:href="#icon-map-marker"></use>
        </svg>
        <a>Virtual Event</a>
      </p>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

Card Age Guide

The Age Guide Card component is a preview of content on another view. On Growing Up NYC, this component is featured on Brain Building Tips where users can navigate to the complete Age Guide associated with the card. This component includes the following elements:

  1. Name of the Age Guide
  2. Description of the Age Guide
  3. Link to read more

Demonstration

2 Months

Discover how your baby is learning, and find events, programs, and tips to help support their growth.
Read more

Markup

<div>
  <div class="age-guide-card border-baby--primary tablet:flex">
    <h3 class="age-guide-card__title bg-baby--primary tablet:w-2/12">
      <a class="age-guide-card__title-link" href="" title="">2 Months</a>
    </h3>
    <div class="age-guide-card__body tablet:w-10/12">Discover how your baby is learning, and find events, programs, and tips to help support their growth.<div>
        <a class="age-guide-card__link" href="" title="Read the age guide for: 2 Months">Read more<svg class="icon--caret--small">
            <use xlink:href="#icon-caret-line-right"></use>
          </svg>
        </a>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

Card Tip

Brain buiding card found on sigle age guide page.

Demonstration

A Tall Tale
During a diaper change, tell your child a silly story about the tallest little child in the world. While you are at it, stretch their arms over their head as you stretch out your words in a playful tone. (The taaaaaaallest baaaaaby in the wooooooorld!)

See what your child is learning

Your voice is your child's favorite sound. Even if they can't talk back yet, they're listening to your words. Stretching out your words and using a sing-song voice makes it fun. This also helps their brain connect sounds and the ways we use our mouths to make them. You may not see it, but inside their brain they are practicing talking with you.

Markup

<div class="bg-color-gray-light p-10">
  <div class="c-block-list__inner">
    <div class="c-tip-card">
      <div class="c-tip-card__header">
        <a href="#">
          <span class="sticker sticker--small c-tip-card__sticker">
            <svg class="icon--large">
              <title>Cash Expenses</title>
              <use xlink:href="#icon-child-care"></use>
            </svg>
          </span>
        </a>
        <a class="c-tip-card__title" href="#">A Tall Tale</a>
      </div>
      <div class="c-tip-card__content">During a diaper change, tell your child a silly story about the tallest little child in the world. While you are at it, stretch their arms over their head as you stretch out your words in a playful tone. (The taaaaaaallest baaaaaby in the wooooooorld!)<h3 class="u-top-spacing-small u-bottom-spacing-small">See what your child is learning</h3>Your voice is your child's favorite sound. Even if they can't talk back yet, they're listening to your words. Stretching out your words and using a sing-song voice makes it fun. This also helps their brain connect sounds and the ways we use our mouths to make them. You may not see it, but inside their brain they are practicing talking with you.</div>
    </div>
    <div class="c-tip-card__banner bg-color-brain-building-tip text-right">
      <svg class="icon--vroom">
        <title>Vroom Logo</title>
        <use xlink:href="#icon-vroom-logo-white"></use>
      </svg>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
